00033 /// Tracks the status of a build: completion fraction, printing updates.
00034 struct BuildStatus {
00035   BuildStatus(const BuildConfig& config);
00036   void PlanHasTotalEdges(int total);
00037   void BuildEdgeStarted(Edge* edge);
00038   void BuildEdgeFinished(Edge* edge, bool success, const string& output,
00039                          int* start_time, int* end_time);
00040 
00041  private:
00042   void PrintStatus(Edge* edge);
00043 
00044   const BuildConfig& config_;
00045 
00046   /// Time the build started.
00047   int64_t start_time_millis_;
00048   /// Time we last printed an update.
00049   int64_t last_update_millis_;
00050 
00051   int started_edges_, finished_edges_, total_edges_;
00052 
00053   /// Map of running edge to time the edge started running.
00054   typedef map<Edge*, int> RunningEdgeMap;
00055   RunningEdgeMap running_edges_;
00056 
00057   /// Whether we can do fancy terminal control codes.
00058   bool smart_terminal_;
00059 };
00060 
00061 BuildStatus::BuildStatus(const BuildConfig& config)
00062     : config_(config),
00063       start_time_millis_(GetTimeMillis()),
00064       last_update_millis_(start_time_millis_),
00065       started_edges_(0), finished_edges_(0), total_edges_(0) {
00066 #ifndef WIN32
00067   const char* term = getenv("TERM");
00068   smart_terminal_ = isatty(1) && term && string(term) != "dumb";
00069 #else
00070   smart_terminal_ = false;
00071 #endif
00072 
00073   // Don't do anything fancy in verbose mode.
00074   if (config_.verbosity != BuildConfig::NORMAL)
00075     smart_terminal_ = false;
00076 }
00077 
00078 void BuildStatus::PlanHasTotalEdges(int total) {
00079   total_edges_ = total;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void BuildStatus::BuildEdgeStarted(Edge* edge) {
00083   int start_time = (int)(GetTimeMillis() - start_time_millis_);
00084   running_edges_.insert(make_pair(edge, start_time));
00085   ++started_edges_;
00086 
00087   PrintStatus(edge);
00088 }
00089 
00090 void BuildStatus::BuildEdgeFinished(Edge* edge,
00091                                     bool success,
00092                                     const string& output,
00093                                     int* start_time,
00094                                     int* end_time) {
00095   int64_t now = GetTimeMillis();
00096   ++finished_edges_;
00097 
00098   RunningEdgeMap::iterator i = running_edges_.find(edge);
00099   *start_time = i->second;
00100   *end_time = (int)(now - start_time_millis_);
00101   int total_time = end_time - start_time;
00102   running_edges_.erase(i);
00103 
00104   if (config_.verbosity == BuildConfig::QUIET)
00105     return;
00106 
00107   if (smart_terminal_)
00108     PrintStatus(edge);
00109 
00110   if (success && output.empty()) {
00111     if (smart_terminal_) {
00112       if (finished_edges_ == total_edges_)
00113         printf("\n");
00114     } else {
00115       if (total_time > 5*1000) {
00116         printf("%.1f%% %d/%d\n", finished_edges_ * 100 / (float)total_edges_,
00117                finished_edges_, total_edges_);
00118         last_update_millis_ = now;
00119       }
00120     }
00121   } else {
00122     if (smart_terminal_)
00123       printf("\n");
00124 
00125     // Print the command that is spewing before printing its output.
00126     if (!success)
00127       printf("FAILED: %s\n", edge->EvaluateCommand().c_str());
00128 
00129     if (!output.empty())
00130       printf("%s", output.c_str());
00131   }
00132 }
00133 
00134 void BuildStatus::PrintStatus(Edge* edge) {
00135   if (config_.verbosity == BuildConfig::QUIET)
00136     return;
00137 
00138   bool force_full_command = config_.verbosity == BuildConfig::VERBOSE;
00139 
00140   string to_print = edge->GetDescription();
00141   if (to_print.empty() || force_full_command)
00142     to_print = edge->EvaluateCommand();
00143 
00144   if (smart_terminal_)
00145     printf("\r");  // Print over previous line, if any.
00146 
00147   int progress_chars = printf("[%d/%d] ", started_edges_, total_edges_);
00148 
00149 #ifndef WIN32
00150   if (smart_terminal_ && !force_full_command) {
00151     // Limit output to width of the terminal if provided so we don't cause
00152     // line-wrapping.
00153     winsize size;
00154     if ((ioctl(0, TIOCGWINSZ, &size) == 0) && size.ws_col) {
00155       const int kMargin = progress_chars + 3;  // Space for [xx/yy] and "...".
00156       if (to_print.size() + kMargin > size.ws_col) {
00157         int substr = std::min(to_print.size(),
00158                               to_print.size() + kMargin - size.ws_col);
00159         to_print = "..." + to_print.substr(substr);
00160       }
00161     }
00162   }
00163 #endif
00164 
00165   printf("%s", to_print.c_str());
00166 
00167   if (smart_terminal_ && !force_full_command) {
00168     printf("\e[K");  // Clear to end of line.
00169     fflush(stdout);
00170   } else {
00171     printf("\n");
00172   }
00173 }

00175 Plan::Plan() : command_edges_(0) {}
00176 
00177 bool Plan::AddTarget(Node* node, string* err) {
00178   vector<Node*> stack;
00179   return AddSubTarget(node, &stack, err);
00180 }
00181 
00182 bool Plan::AddSubTarget(Node* node, vector<Node*>* stack, string* err) {
00183   Edge* edge = node->in_edge_;
00184   if (!edge) {  // Leaf node.
00185     if (node->dirty_) {
00186       string referenced;
00187       if (!stack->empty())
00188         referenced = ", needed by '" + stack->back()->file_->path_ + "',";
00189       *err = "'" + node->file_->path_ + "'" + referenced + " missing "
00190              "and no known rule to make it";
00191     }
00192     return false;
00193   }
00194   assert(edge);
00195 
00196   if (CheckDependencyCycle(node, stack, err))
00197     return false;
00198 
00199   if (!node->dirty())
00200     return false;  // Don't need to do anything.
00201   if (want_.find(edge) != want_.end())
00202     return true;  // We've already enqueued it.
00203   want_.insert(edge);
00204   if (!edge->is_phony())
00205     ++command_edges_;
00206 
00207   stack->push_back(node);
00208   bool awaiting_inputs = false;
00209   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = edge->inputs_.begin();
00210        i != edge->inputs_.end(); ++i) {
00211     if (AddSubTarget(*i, stack, err)) {
00212       awaiting_inputs = true;
00213     } else if (!err->empty()) {
00214       return false;
00215     }
00216   }
00217   assert(stack->back() == node);
00218   stack->pop_back();
00219 
00220   if (!awaiting_inputs)
00221     ready_.insert(edge);
00222 
00223   return true;
00224 }
00225 
00226 bool Plan::CheckDependencyCycle(Node* node, vector<Node*>* stack, string* err) {
00227   vector<Node*>::reverse_iterator ri =
00228       find(stack->rbegin(), stack->rend(), node);
00229   if (ri == stack->rend())
00230     return false;
00231 
00232   // Add this node onto the stack to make it clearer where the loop
00233   // is.
00234   stack->push_back(node);
00235 
00236   vector<Node*>::iterator start = find(stack->begin(), stack->end(), node);
00237   *err = "dependency cycle: ";
00238   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = start; i != stack->end(); ++i) {
00239     if (i != start)
00240       err->append(" -> ");
00241     err->append((*i)->file_->path_);
00242   }
00243   return true;
00244 }
00245 
00246 Edge* Plan::FindWork() {
00247   if (ready_.empty())
00248     return NULL;
00249   set<Edge*>::iterator i = ready_.begin();
00250   Edge* edge = *i;
00251   ready_.erase(i);
00252   return edge;
00253 }
00254 
00255 void Plan::EdgeFinished(Edge* edge) {
00256   want_.erase(edge);
00257 
00258   // Check off any nodes we were waiting for with this edge.
00259   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = edge->outputs_.begin();
00260        i != edge->outputs_.end(); ++i) {
00261     NodeFinished(*i);
00262   }
00263 }
00264 
00265 void Plan::NodeFinished(Node* node) {
00266   // See if we we want any edges from this node.
00267   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator i = node->out_edges_.begin();
00268        i != node->out_edges_.end(); ++i) {
00269     if (want_.find(*i) != want_.end()) {
00270       // See if the edge is now ready.
00271       bool ready = true;
00272       for (vector<Node*>::iterator j = (*i)->inputs_.begin();
00273            j != (*i)->inputs_.end(); ++j) {
00274         if ((*j)->dirty()) {
00275           ready = false;
00276           break;
00277         }
00278       }
00279       if (ready)
00280         ready_.insert(*i);
00281     }
00282   }
00283 }
00284 
00285 void Plan::Dump() {
00286   printf("pending: %d\n", (int)want_.size());
00287   for (set<Edge*>::iterator i = want_.begin(); i != want_.end(); ++i) {
00288     (*i)->Dump();
00289   }
00290   printf("ready: %d\n", (int)ready_.size());
00291 }

00293 struct RealCommandRunner : public CommandRunner {
00294   RealCommandRunner(const BuildConfig& config) : config_(config) {}
00295   virtual ~RealCommandRunner() {}
00296   virtual bool CanRunMore();
00297   virtual bool StartCommand(Edge* edge);
00298   virtual Edge* WaitForCommand(bool* success, string* output);
00299 
00300   const BuildConfig& config_;
00301   SubprocessSet subprocs_;
00302   map<Subprocess*, Edge*> subproc_to_edge_;
00303 };
00304 
00305 bool RealCommandRunner::CanRunMore() {
00306   return ((int)subprocs_.running_.size()) < config_.parallelism;
00307 }
00308 
00309 bool RealCommandRunner::StartCommand(Edge* edge) {
00310   string command = edge->EvaluateCommand();
00311   Subprocess* subproc = new Subprocess;
00312   subproc_to_edge_.insert(make_pair(subproc, edge));
00313   if (!subproc->Start(&subprocs_, command))
00314     return false;
00315 
00316   subprocs_.Add(subproc);
00317   return true;
00318 }
00319 
00320 Edge* RealCommandRunner::WaitForCommand(bool* success, string* output) {
00321   Subprocess* subproc;
00322   while ((subproc = subprocs_.NextFinished()) == NULL) {
00323     subprocs_.DoWork();
00324   }
00325 
00326   *success = subproc->Finish();
00327   *output = subproc->GetOutput();
00328 
00329   map<Subprocess*, Edge*>::iterator i = subproc_to_edge_.find(subproc);
00330   Edge* edge = i->second;
00331   subproc_to_edge_.erase(i);
00332 
00333   delete subproc;
00334   return edge;
00335 }
00336 
00337 /// A CommandRunner that doesn't actually run the commands.
00338 struct DryRunCommandRunner : public CommandRunner {
00339   virtual ~DryRunCommandRunner() {}
00340   virtual bool CanRunMore() {
00341     return true;
00342   }
00343   virtual bool StartCommand(Edge* edge) {
00344     finished_.push(edge);
00345     return true;
00346   }
00347   virtual Edge* WaitForCommand(bool* success, string* output) {
00348     if (finished_.empty())
00349       return NULL;
00350     *success = true;
00351     Edge* edge = finished_.front();
00352     finished_.pop();
00353     return edge;
00354   }
00355 
00356   queue<Edge*> finished_;
00357 };

00359 Builder::Builder(State* state, const BuildConfig& config)
00360     : state_(state), config_(config) {
00361   disk_interface_ = new RealDiskInterface;
00362   if (config.dry_run)
00363     command_runner_ = new DryRunCommandRunner;
00364   else
00365     command_runner_ = new RealCommandRunner(config);
00366   status_ = new BuildStatus(config);
00367   log_ = state->build_log_;
00368 }
00369 
00370 Node* Builder::AddTarget(const string& name, string* err) {
00371   Node* node = state_->LookupNode(name);
00372   if (!node) {
00373     *err = "unknown target: '" + name + "'";
00374     return NULL;
00375   }
00376   if (!AddTarget(node, err))
00377     return NULL;
00378   return node;
00379 }
00380 
00381 bool Builder::AddTarget(Node* node, string* err) {
00382   node->file_->StatIfNecessary(disk_interface_);
00383   if (node->in_edge_) {
00384     if (!node->in_edge_->RecomputeDirty(state_, disk_interface_, err))
00385       return false;
00386   }
00387   if (!node->dirty_)
00388     return false;  // Intentionally no error.
00389 
00390   if (!plan_.AddTarget(node, err))
00391     return false;
00392 
00393   return true;
00394 }
00395 
00396 bool Builder::Build(string* err) {
00397   if (!plan_.more_to_do()) {
00398     *err = "no work to do";
00399     return true;
00400   }
00401 
00402   status_->PlanHasTotalEdges(plan_.command_edge_count());
00403   int pending_commands = 0;
00404   int failures_allowed = config_.swallow_failures;
00405 
00406   // This main loop runs the entire build process.
00407   // It is structured like this:
00408   // First, we attempt to start as many commands as allowed by the
00409   // command runner.
00410   // Second, we attempt to wait for / reap the next finished command.
00411   // If we can do neither of those, the build is stuck, and we report
00412   // an error.
00413   while (plan_.more_to_do()) {
00414     // See if we can start any more commands.
00415     if (command_runner_->CanRunMore()) {
00416       if (Edge* edge = plan_.FindWork()) {
00417         if (!StartEdge(edge, err))
00418           return false;
00419 
00420         if (edge->is_phony())
00421           FinishEdge(edge, true, "");
00422         else
00423           ++pending_commands;
00424 
00425         // We made some progress; go back to the main loop.
00426         continue;
00427       }
00428     }
00429 
00430     // See if we can reap any finished commands.
00431     if (pending_commands) {
00432       bool success;
00433       string output;
00434       Edge* edge;
00435       if ((edge = command_runner_->WaitForCommand(&success, &output))) {
00436         --pending_commands;
00437         FinishEdge(edge, success, output);
00438         if (!success) {
00439           if (--failures_allowed < 0) {
00440             if (config_.swallow_failures > 0)
00441               *err = "subcommands failed";
00442             else
00443               *err = "subcommand failed";
00444             return false;
00445           }
00446         }
00447 
00448         // We made some progress; start the main loop over.
00449         continue;
00450       }
00451     }
00452 
00453     // If we get here, we can neither enqueue new commands nor are any running.
00454     if (pending_commands) {
00455       *err = "stuck: pending commands but none to wait for? [this is a bug]";
00456       return false;
00457     }
00458 
00459     // If we get here, we cannot make any more progress.
00460     if (failures_allowed < config_.swallow_failures) {
00461       *err = "cannot make progress due to previous errors";
00462       return false;
00463     } else {
00464       *err = "stuck [this is a bug]";
00465       return false;
00466     }
00467   }
00468 
00469   return true;
00470 }
00471 
00472 bool Builder::StartEdge(Edge* edge, string* err) {
00473   if (edge->is_phony())
00474     return true;
00475 
00476   status_->BuildEdgeStarted(edge);
00477 
00478   // Create directories necessary for outputs.
00479   // XXX: this will block; do we care?
00480   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = edge->outputs_.begin();
00481        i != edge->outputs_.end(); ++i) {
00482     if (!disk_interface_->MakeDirs((*i)->file_->path_))
00483       return false;
00484   }
00485 
00486   // Compute command and start it.
00487   string command = edge->EvaluateCommand();
00488   if (!command_runner_->StartCommand(edge)) {
00489     err->assign("command '" + command + "' failed.");
00490     return false;
00491   }
00492 
00493   return true;
00494 }
00495 
00496 void Builder::FinishEdge(Edge* edge, bool success, const string& output) {
00497   if (success) {
00498     for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = edge->outputs_.begin();
00499          i != edge->outputs_.end(); ++i) {
00500       (*i)->dirty_ = false;
00501     }
00502     plan_.EdgeFinished(edge);
00503   }
00504 
00505   if (edge->is_phony())
00506     return;
00507 
00508   int start_time, end_time;
00509   status_->BuildEdgeFinished(edge, success, output, &start_time, &end_time);
00510   if (success && log_)
00511     log_->RecordCommand(edge, start_time, end_time);
00512 }
